body:
It seems to me as if you are defining circular class loading hierarchies. With Mockito 2, we are applying more fine grained locking to improve concurrency. The difference is displayed in the stack trace where `findOrInsert` aquires a lock for the class loader of the mock class before creating a mock. The previous solution always aquired a global lock what made it impossible to create to mock classes concurrently.

The relevant part:

```
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:404)
- waiting to lock <0x00000007959e4a78> (a sbt.classpath.ClasspathUtilities$$anon$1)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:411)
- locked <0x0000000795a868e8> (a sbt.classpath.ClasspathFilter)
	
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:404)
- waiting to lock <0x0000000795a868e8> (a sbt.classpath.ClasspathFilter)
at net.bytebuddy.TypeCache.findOrInsert(TypeCache.java:161)
- locked <0x00000007959e4a78> (a sbt.classpath.ClasspathUtilities$$anon$1)
```

How can it be that `sbt.classpath.ClasspathFilter` delegates to `sbt.classpath.ClasspathUtilities$$anon$1` where the latter apparently also reqires locking the former? Class loaders should only be used in strict hierarchies.

So both Maps are abstract, I'll try mocking concrete implementations. That might have caused the classloaders to kick in. I try to rewrite some of the tests to use specific implementations instead of abstract classes, but for i.e. ImmutableMap that's gonna be difficult as far as I can see.

edit:
Switched to a concrete Map, just deadlocks somewhere else now, while mocking a Finagle Service[Request, Response] and a simple trait, same locks as before though.

```
Found one Java-level deadlock:
=============================
"Timer-0":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007f4d08002a48 (object 0x00000000c2857fb8, a sbt.classpath.ClasspathUtilities$$anon$1),
  which is held by "pool-9-thread-6-ScalaTest-running-BRequestFilterSpec"
"pool-9-thread-6-ScalaTest-running-BRequestFilterSpec":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007f4d34003f08 (object 0x00000000c2857f60, a sbt.classpath.ClasspathFilter),
  which is held by "pool-9-thread-7-ScalaTest-running-JFilterSpec"
"pool-9-thread-7-ScalaTest-running-JFilterSpec":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007f4d08002a48 (object 0x00000000c2857fb8, a sbt.classpath.ClasspathUtilities$$anon$1),
  which is held by "pool-9-thread-6-ScalaTest-running-BRequestFilterSpec"
```

issue.title: Deadlock when sbt test in parallel
issue.body:

I am using sbt and ScalaTest and deadlock happened quite frequently when I ran the tests in parallel.

issue.title: Failure: No output has been received in the last 10m0s

milestone.title: invalid/not release-bound
milestone.description: Issues that are closed but do not belong to any release, for example because they were questions rather than software issues, they only affected infrastructure, code quality or testing, or we otherwise decided not to act on them.

repository.name: alpakka
repository.description: Alpakka is a Reactive Enterprise Integration library for Java and Scala, based on Reactive Streams and Akka.

issue.body:
The build regularly fails due to being stalled, for example https://travis-ci.org/akka/alpakka/jobs/252702213 .

I wonder if we could somehow at least take a stack dump to get some idea of where it's waiting.

body: I've run into this same problem recently as well and my jstack was identical to the OP's. I've started playing around with the mockito versions and I'm not sure if this helps, but using mockito 2.6.6 in my tests didn't result in a deadlock, while using 2.6.7+ did result in deadlock.

Maybe we need to add a property that can be enabled to avoid the more fine-grained locking for the type cache. I would still like to know what is causing this as I even stress-tested the cache lock but I cannot reproduce the locking.

Is there any project that I can build that reliably reproduces this?

I'm not sure if it's the same problem but I got similar deadlock after specs2 update:

issue.title: Prevent class loading race condition

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
Allow singleton locking in context with class loading races.

Fixes #1067

issue.title: Scala sbt project hangs indefinitely during tests.

repository.name: travis-ci
repository.description: Free continuous integration platform for GitHub projects.

issue.body:
In my xtract project (https://github.com/lucidsoftware/xtract) the travis-ci build consistently hangs and eventually times out, usually while the tests are running, but sometimes during compilation. 

This doesn't happen if I run sbt locally, or even if I run it a the travisci-ci-garnet docker container. When I run the test myself they take seconds.

I have tried several things to try and fix this including:

- trying sudo both false and true
- different versions of sbt
- splitting and combining the compile and test sbt commands
- with and without forking enabled for tests
- using both opnejdk8 and oraclejdk8

The build worked 4 months ago, but started breaking consistently, after I made a small change in september. 

My most recent .travis.yml file:

```yaml
language: scala

scala:
  - 2.11.11
  - 2.12.3

jdk:
  - openjdk8

dist: trusty
sudo: false

cache:
  directories:
    - $HOME/.ivy2/cache
    - $HOME/.sbt/

after_success:
  - sbt ++$TRAVIS_SCALA_VERSION package
  - |
    if [ -n "$TRAVIS_TAG" ] || ([ "$TRAVIS_PULL_REQUEST" == false ] && [ "$TRAVIS_BRANCH" == master ])
    then
      mkdir ~/.pgp
      echo $PGP_PUBLIC | base64 --decode > ~/.pgp/pubring
      echo $PGP_SECRET | base64 --decode > ~/.pgp/secring
      echo "Publishing snapshot"
      sbt ++$TRAVIS_SCALA_VERSION xtract/publishSigned xtractTesting/publishSigned
    fi
deploy:
  api_key: $GITHUB_AUTH
  file:
    - xtract-core/target/**/*.jar
    - testing/target/**/*.jar
  file_glob: true
  provider: releases
  skip_cleanup: true
  on:
    tags: true

script:
  - sbt ++$TRAVIS_SCALA_VERSION compile
  - travis_wait sbt -debug ++$TRAVIS_SCALA_VERSION test

install: sbt ++$TRAVIS_SCALA_VERSION update
before_cache:
  #Avoid unncessary cache updates
  - find $HOME/.ivy2 -name "ivydata-*.properties" -print -delete
  - find $HOME/.sbt  -name "*.lock" -print -delete
```

body: In my case I had to fix it by adding `sequential` to the Specification to preven examples from being executed in parallel.
Hey guys, we're planning to merge the fix soon. Thank you for patience and reporting another use case here!

issue.title: Issue#235 depencencies

repository.name: book-api
repository.description: API for accessing books from The Global Digital Library

issue.body:
GlobalDigitalLibraryio/issues#235
* Update scalatra and related dependencies.

issue.title: Specs2 incompatible with newest version of Mockito
issue.body:
I'm running into a Mockito issue where mocks of singletons can cause deadlock race conditions. See https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/1067

Upgrading mockito to the newly released 2.16.1, however, causes:
```
Exception in thread "specs2-4" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.mockito.internal.invocation.ArgumentsProcessor.expandArgs(Lorg/mockito/internal/invocation/MockitoMethod;[Ljava/lang/Object;)[Ljava/lang/Object;
	at org.mockito.internal.invocation.InterceptedInvocation.<init>(InterceptedInvocation.java:44)
	at org.mockito.internal.invocation.DefaultInvocationFactory.createInvocation(DefaultInvocationFactory.java:42)
	at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.MockMethodInterceptor.doIntercept(MockMethodInterceptor.java:63)
	at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.MockMethodInterceptor.doIntercept(MockMethodInterceptor.java:49)
	at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.MockMethodInterceptor$DispatcherDefaultingToRealMethod.interceptAbstract(MockMethodInterceptor.java:128)
```

issue.title: Disable parallel execution of tests

repository.name: finagle-prometheus
repository.description: Provides a bridge between Finagle and Prometheus metrics

issue.body: This was causing Travis CI builds to hang, see the following issue on GitHub: https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/1067

issue.title: Frequent deadlocks when running tests

labels.name: runtime
labels.description: Affects the runtime library part of this project.

repository.name: sbt-jupiter-interface
repository.description: Implementation of sbt's test interface for JUnit 5's Jupiter module

issue.body:
Running parallel tests while cross building causes frequent deadlocks which seem to be occur when creating mock objects with `Mockito`. 

Related issues:

* mockito/mockito#1067
* sbt/sbt#3022

```

=============================

  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007f9408091ee8 (object 0x00000000f8e7c848, a [I),
  which is held by "pool-93-thread-4"
"pool-93-thread-4":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007f9424a76e98 (object 0x00000000eb401f70, a sbt.classpath.ClasspathUtilities$$anon$1),
  which is held by "pool-93-thread-6"

Java stack information for the threads listed above:
===================================================
"pool-93-thread-6":
        at net.bytebuddy.ByteBuddy.subclass(ByteBuddy.java:343)

        at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.TypeCachingBytecodeGenerator.mockClass(TypeCachingBytecodeGenerator.java:32)
        at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.SubclassByteBuddyMockMaker.createMockType(SubclassByteBuddyMockMaker.java:71)
        at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.SubclassByteBuddyMockMaker.createMock(SubclassByteBuddyMockMaker.java:42)
        at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.ByteBuddyMockMaker.createMock(ByteBuddyMockMaker.java:25)

        at net.bytebuddy.ByteBuddy.subclass(ByteBuddy.java:343)

        at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.TypeCachingBytecodeGenerator$1.call(TypeCachingBytecodeGenerator.java:34)

        - locked <0x00000000f8b79e00> (a java.lang.Object)
        at net.bytebuddy.TypeCache$WithInlineExpunction.findOrInsert(TypeCache.java:355)
        at org.mockito.internal.creation.bytebuddy.TypeCachingBytecodeGenerator.mockClass(TypeCachingBytecodeGenerator.java:32)
```
